intro: Sesbania bispinosa var. bispinosa, commonly known as the two-spined sesbania, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a legume, belonging to the family Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, hairy pods containing several seeds. Sesbania bispinosa var. bispinosa is often used for forage and soil enrichment due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
